title: How to Prepare for Tomorrow’s Wars
content: Just as established corporations facing challenges from innovative startups must adapt or die, militaries must continually renew themselves to remain effective against emerging threats. For democracies today, this means investing in evolving technologies and embracing new ways of operating.
creator: James Ryseff
sourceDescription: Project Syndicate - The World’s Opinion Page

title: Could Viktor Orbán Lose in April?
content: Before Donald Trump arrived on the scene in the United States, Viktor Orbán’s Hungary had already heralded the rise of populist illiberalism and the new far right. That is why all who seek to prevent or escape strongman rule will be watching the upcoming parliamentary election closely.
creator: Zselyke Csaky
sourceDescription: Project Syndicate - The World’s Opinion Page

title: Development Is Hard Power
content: In today's world, defense spending matters, and increased military investment is a legitimate policy response to security threats. But without parallel investment in development, it is only half a security strategy.
creator: Alexander De Croo
sourceDescription: Project Syndicate - The World’s Opinion Page

title: Stablecoins Are Raising New Risks for Emerging Markets
content: Stablecoins are rapidly evolving from payment instruments into full-fledged financial infrastructure in Africa, Asia, and Latin America, introducing risks that the US-centric debate has largely overlooked. As parallel payment systems grow beyond the scope of existing banking rules, policymakers must expand the regulatory perimeter.
creator: Eduardo Levy Yeyati
sourceDescription: Project Syndicate - The World’s Opinion Page

title: When Stronger IP Protection Stifles Innovation
content: Countries at the technological frontier need strong intellectual-property protections to stimulate innovation. But a weaker IP-rights regime can enable latecomers to build their capabilities through imitation and minor improvements, before they are capable of producing high-level patentable inventions.
creator: Keun Lee
sourceDescription: Project Syndicate - The World’s Opinion Page

title: Why Is Trump Waging War on Somali Immigrants?
content: US President Donald Trump’s fixation on Somali immigrants is not arbitrary; it is part of a broader campaign to demonize non-white immigrants as criminals and civilizational threats. But that narrative depends on ignorance of Somali integration and of America’s own role in Somalia’s collapse.
creator: Adekeye Adebajo
sourceDescription: Project Syndicate - The World’s Opinion Page

title: The High Price of Political Paranoia
content: The more centralized a political system is, the more likely it is that national interests and goals will take a backseat to the leader’s personal whims, desires, and insecurities. Versions of this dynamic are currently playing out in Russia, China, and the United States.
creator: Nina L. Khrushcheva
sourceDescription: Project Syndicate - The World’s Opinion Page

title: The Economics of the Supreme Court’s Tariff Ruling
content: The US Supreme Court has ruled that President Donald Trump’s tariffs are unconstitutional, effectively positioning the rule of law as the ultimate arbiter of a terrible economic policy. This sends an important message: US policies may not be personalized by the whims of a vindictive and uninformed wannabe autocrat.
creator: Stephen S. Roach
sourceDescription: Project Syndicate - The World’s Opinion Page

title: The Perils of Premature Automation
content: Developing countries would be wise to pursue deliberate sequencing before embracing automation. That is because embedding AI in fragmented and outdated administrative systems and sectors with stagnant productivity will most likely eliminate middle-skill jobs without creating new engines of growth.
creator: Mark-Alexandre Doumba
sourceDescription: Project Syndicate - The World’s Opinion Page

title: Housing Has a Data Problem
content: The lack of basic tools to track and understand housing has resulted in a patchwork of individual programs and little clarity on whether any of them meet basic access and affordability needs. The promise of AI, which requires structured, standardized inputs, makes addressing this data-infrastructure gap more urgent.
creator: Rosanne Haggerty
sourceDescription: Project Syndicate - The World’s Opinion Page

title: Europe Must Not Abandon Its Climate Ambitions
content: US President Donald Trump has revoked the legal basis for regulating greenhouse-gas emissions in the US. But German Chancellor Friedrich Merz’s comments about possibly revising the EU Emission Trading Scheme could be more damaging, because Europe’s carbon-pricing framework is finally inducing other countries to act.
creator: Catherine Wolfram
sourceDescription: Project Syndicate - The World’s Opinion Page

title: A European Solution for Germany’s China Challenge
content: German Chancellor Friedrich Merz's upcoming visit to China comes at a pivotal moment. China's export prowess is driving a national debate about lagging competitiveness, and that debate is taking place alongside the European Union's efforts to devise a unified China strategy at a time when the United States appears increasingly unreliable.
creator: Daniela Schwarzer
sourceDescription: Project Syndicate - The World’s Opinion Page

title: Debt Restructuring Is Senegal’s Best Bet
content: Senegal does not have any pain-free options for escaping its intensifying debt crisis. But absent large volumes of cheap liquidity, attempting to repay its debts at all costs would likely prove costlier than biting the bullet and initiating debt-restructuring negotiations.
creator: Abdoulaye Ndiaye
sourceDescription: Project Syndicate - The World’s Opinion Page

title: How Ukraine’s Economy Has Defied the Odds
content: Four years of grueling war have devastated Ukraine’s infrastructure, displaced millions of people, and pushed its economy to the brink. But sound policy, a surge in defense spending, sustained international aid, and restored air and sea access have stabilized demand and brought GDP close to prewar levels.
creator: Tatyana Deryugina
sourceDescription: Project Syndicate - The World’s Opinion Page

title: Killing the Goose that Lays the Gold Medal
content: Winning the race for global preeminence – whether on the Olympic ice rink or in the laboratory – cannot be achieved by closing off from the world. If America turns talent away, talent will not vanish; it will relocate, and other countries will claim the medals and the breakthroughs.
creator: Nancy Qian
sourceDescription: Project Syndicate - The World’s Opinion Page

title: The End of a Lie
content: In his now-famous speech to this year's gathering of global elites in Davos, Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney rightly drew on a key insight from the late Václav Havel. Institutions fall first in the realm of belief, when people begin abandoning their assigned roles in legitimizing rituals.
creator: Antara Haldar
sourceDescription: Project Syndicate - The World’s Opinion Page

title: Inequality Will Make the Next Pandemic Worse
content: Crowded living conditions, frontline occupations, and poverty all fuel the spread of pandemics, as do poor nutrition and baseline health characteristics. Unless these issues – which came to define the COVID-19 pandemic – are addressed head-on, the most vulnerable will surely suffer the most in the next crisis.
creator: Joseph E. Stiglitz
sourceDescription: Project Syndicate - The World’s Opinion Page

title: European Security Needs Turkey
content: Regardless of the turn that future US administrations take, Europe can no longer rely on American supremacy and goodwill, especially when it comes to its own defense and security. The quest for strategic autonomy has begun, and it should include re-engagement with one of NATO's leading military powers.
creator: Abdullah Gül
sourceDescription: Project Syndicate - The World’s Opinion Page

title: Why MAGA Fears Europe
content: US President Donald Trump and his acolytes have long promoted the narrative that the European Union is weak and misguided, and there was no let-up at the World Economic Forum’s annual gathering Davos in January or at this month’s Munich Security Conference. But the truth is that Europe’s social-market model and commitment to openness continue to pay dividends. Far from doubting itself, the EU should double down on its strengths and, as the US-China geopolitical rivalry heats up, tout them as an example for the rest of the world.
creator: PS Commentators
sourceDescription: Project Syndicate - The World’s Opinion Page

title: Global Cooperation in a Time of Geopolitical Disruption
content: With the rules-based international order breaking down, “minilateralism” might offer a means of devising new ideas – in particular, for scalable interventions that tangibly improve people’s lives. Without interventions that highlight the benefits of international engagement, broad-based cooperation will remain a hard sell.
creator: Prabhat Upadhyaya
sourceDescription: Project Syndicate - The World’s Opinion Page

title: Quantum Computing Could Fix AI’s Sustainability Problem
content: As generative AI pushes power grids to their limits, the industry largely favors incremental measures that fail to address underlying issues. The path toward sustainable AI lies in combining quantum computing with energy-efficient application design.
creator: Bertrand Badré
sourceDescription: Project Syndicate - The World’s Opinion Page

title: MAGA’s Approach to Europe Hasn’t Changed
content: Although the speech that US Secretary of State Marco Rubio delivered to this year’s Munich Security Conference was softer in tone than the one that Vice President JD Vance gave last year, the Europe he celebrated was that of the ethno-nationalist far right. Europe is on its own, and it must start acting like it.
creator: Mark Leonard
sourceDescription: Project Syndicate - The World’s Opinion Page

title: The State of Trump
content: US President Donald Trump’s State of the Union address showed a man who is stuck, exhausted, and out of options. To move beyond the current system of competitive authoritarianism to full-blown fascism, he must give the country a war that it does not want, and then win – but that is out of his reach.
creator: Timothy Snyder
sourceDescription: Project Syndicate - The World’s Opinion Page

title: The Supreme Court’s Tariff Ruling Changes Little
content: The US Supreme Court’s ruling on Donald Trump’s tariffs may modify the legal facade of US trade policy, as well as produce a brief surge of imports into the United States. But, ultimately, it is unlikely to reduce the overall height or significantly alter the country composition of US trade barriers.
creator: Shang-Jin Wei
sourceDescription: Project Syndicate - The World’s Opinion Page
